intro: Beauprea pancheri, commonly known as the Pancheri beauprea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Beauprea pancheri is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, well-drained soils.
